Two activities must save some informations so I use in both a MySQLiteHelper to access the database.I read here that building SQLiteOpenHelper as static data member could be a good practice so I did this. The static factory method ensures that there exists only one DatabaseHelper instance at any time.I create in each activity a SQLiteOpenHelper that uses the method getWritableDatabase() but I don't know where to use the close() method. Should I put this method after every modification or once at the end of the activity ? Thank you =)

Answer: <<<api>>>: SQLiteDatabase.query
<<<code>>>: 
```java
SQLiteDatabase db = SQLiteOpenHelper.getWritableDatabase();
Cursor cursor = db.query(tableName, columns, selection, selectionArgs, groupBy, having, orderBy);
```
<<<explanation>>>: Use the query method to execute a query on the database. The parameters are the same as for the Cursor query(String table, String[] columns, String selection, String[] selectionArgs, String groupBy, String having, String orderBy) method.
After you're done with the query, you should close the cursor. This can be done by calling the close() method on the Cursor object.
```java
cursor.close();
```
This is a good practice because it ensures that the resources used by the cursor are released properly.

```java
SQLiteDatabase db = SQLiteOpenHelper.getWritableDatabase();
Cursor cursor = db.query(tableName, columns, selection, selectionArgs, groupBy, having, orderBy);
// Use the cursor
...
cursor.close();
```
This way, you ensure that the database connection is closed after you're done with it.
